item.title: VSCode & Jupyter Notebook
item.description:
Install Visual Studio Code & Set Up Jupyter Notebook in VSCode

Step 1: Install Visual Studio Code

Go to the official VSCode website and download the installer for your operating system.

Step 2: Install the Jupyter and Python Extensions

1. Install the Jupyter Extension :

  • Click on the Extensions icon on the left sidebar in VSCode (or press Cmd+Shift+X).
  • Search for “Jupyter” in the Extensions Marketplace.
  • Click Install next to the “Jupyter” extension.

Step 3: Open or Create a Jupyter Notebook in VSCode

1. Open the Command Palette :

Press Cmd+Shift+P (on macOS) or Ctrl+Shift+P (on Windows/Linux) to open the Command Palette in VSCode.

item.title: Setting Up Julia Environment
item.description:
Install Julia

Step 1: Download & Install Julia

Visit the official Julia website and download the installer for your operating system.

Step 2: Install Julia Extension for Visual Studio Code

To use Julia in VSCode, you need to install the Julia extension. Please follow the official website for installation instructions.

Environment Setup in VSCode - Mac Version

Assuming VSCode is already installed, the process for setting up the Julia environment is as follows:

item.title: Setting Up Python Environment
item.description:
Install Python

Step 1: Download & Install Python

Visit the official Python website and download the installer for your operating system.

Step 2: Install Python Extension for Visual Studio Code

To use Python in VSCode, you need to install the Python extension. Please follow the official website for installation instructions.

Environment Setup in VSCode - Mac Version
